rest.sentence: Organic-inorganic hybrid perovskite light-harvesting materials are becoming one of the most capable potential contenders in photovoltaic technology because of their low-cost fabrication, ease of processing, and high power conversion efficiency
However, it is still challenging to extend these perovskite materials with a cost-effective fabrication technique to meet the demand for roll-to-roll manufacturing and mass production
Several fabrication methods have been developed and tested with different device configurations to enhance properties like device stability and photon-to-current conversion efficiency
The quality of thin-films has a vital role in determining the suitable fabrication method and appropriate structure to improve the overall performance of perovskite devices

This review article summarizes various deposition techniques used in fabrication of perovskite solar cells , device technologies for perovskite light-absorbing heterostructures and future research perspectives.
Download : Download high-res image Download : Download full-size image

Since the development of PSCs, several fabrication methods have been tried and demonstrated for the preparation of the perovskite thin-film layer, such as spin coating method , vacuum vapor deposition , vapor assisted solution process method , atomic layer deposition , chemical vapor deposition , printing method, spray coating, slot-die coating, doctor-blade coating, etc ,

Among various fabrication methods, solution process techniques such as one-step spin coating and two-step spin-coating are widely used to prepare a perovskite light-absorbing layer due to the low-cost and easy fabrication process
However, the difficulties such as non-uniformity, control of film morphology, and thickness restrict the path of this technique to use at a large fabrication scale ,
As an alternative to the solution process technique, the vacuum evaporation method, has been employed to grow a perovskite layer with uniform thickness and controlled morphology
For a similar purpose, the vapor-assisted solution process  method is derived from the two-step deposition technique
VASP follows kinetic reactivity and thermodynamic stability of absorber during the fabrication process
However, the glove box requirements, versatility, unsuitable for mass production, etc., make this process tedious
Chemical vapor deposition  has been developed to manipulate the problem associated with the VASP technique
In the CVD method, solid film formation occurs by reactions between one or more precursors either on the substrate's surface or in the gas phase ,

Similarly, atomic layer deposition  technique is also a powerful technique for deposing precursor solution on the substrate material because of their self-limiting reaction, which provides additional control on film thickness ,
Recently, roll-to-roll compatible process ,  such as slot die coating, doctor-blade, spray coating, etc
has also been investigated as a fabrication technique for perovskite thin-film solar cells in the field of large-area mass production manufacturing , .
This featured review article highlights the fabrication techniques involved in preparing the perovskite light-absorbing layer from the perspective of perovskite-based photovoltaic devices
Finally, future research directions based upon the reported results in the area of PSCs are also suggested.
The solution synthesis method of PSC material is roughly divided into two types: one step spin-coating and two steps spin-coating according to the number of deposition steps , .
In this review article, the device fabrication techniques of PSCs are discussed
The benefits and drawbacks associated with various fabrication methods are listed in Table 1 and device output of PSCs fabricated through various deposition methods are shown in Table S1
Optimum balance between fabrication method and device quality like defects, film purity, and surface coverage is required to enhance the electrical properties and PCE.

In this paper, the oxygen reduction reaction  catalyst is synthesized by daylily that needs to absorb phosphorus-containing and sulfur-containing fertilizers during the growth process
Excellent phosphorus- and sulfur-containing porous carbon materials derived from daylily were prepared by carbonization at different temperatures
From the analysis of the experimental results, it was concluded that D900-3 derived from daylily by two rapid carbonization methods had the best catalytic effect
Compared with the commercial Pt/C , the difference in half-peak potential was only 20 mV
This paper not only enriches non-Pt-based ORR catalysts, but also provides a new way of phosphorus-sulfur co-doping.

The present studies are focused on the effect of divalent Ca2+ ion on the structural, magnetic, and optical properties of Bi0.80La0.20FeO3  ceramic samples, synthesized via conventional solid-state reaction route

The addition of Ca2+ ion into BLFO substituting Bi, creates distortion in the structure and leads a phase transition from rhombohedral  to orthorhombic  crystal symmetry, confirmed by Rietveld analysis and further supported by Raman spectroscopy, attributed to a decrease in tilt angle for anti-phase rotation of BO6 octahedra
Weak ferromagnetic ordering was observed for all Bi0.80-xCaxLa0.20FeO3 samples with Ca at.% of 0.03 , 0.06  and 0.12 , associated to changes in Fe–O–Fe angle
The remnant magnetization has been found to increase from 1.2×10−3 emu/g for BLFO to 9.1x10−3 emu/g for BCLFO12
Similar trends were found in the deconvoluted ferromagnetic contribution with Ca2+ ion doping
Moreover, Arrott plot analysis suggests a second order meta-magnetic transition for all samples
Room temperature dielectric properties were improved with Ca2+ ion substitutions
The optical band gap significantly reduced from 2.10 eV for BLFO to 1.93 eV for BCLFO12, indicating the distortion induced by the Ca2+ ion.
Multiferroics are the materials comprising of at least two ferroic orders like ferromagnetism, ferroelectricity, or ferroelasticity all in a single phase
Extensive research is underway in the field of material science on multiferroism as it is rarely observed in materials
It has widespread applications especially in spintronics
In this view, bismuth ferrite  is one of the best multiferroic materials among the number of available multiferroic materials
It is capable of showing ferroelectricity as well as antiferromagnetic nature simultaneously at room temperature

In the present work, efforts have been made to synthesize the BiFeO3 in pure phase as well as with the doping of Cobalt in the ratio of 2 %, 4 %, and 8 % via solid state reaction route and were denoted by BFC0, BFC2, BFC4 and BFC8 respectively
We have optimized our samples on specific calcination as well as sintering temperature
Structural and dielectric analysis has been done and the enhancement has been concluded in the end results
The structural analysis confirms the distorted rhombohedral structure along with some impurities
Impurities reduce on doping BiFeO3 with “Co”
The BFC2 has the maximum dielectric constant , dielectric loss  in comparison to other compositions.
Short flax fibers are by-products that have no current used yet
An interesting idea is to convert them as a fully biodegrable nitrogen source possible to spread in the crop fields
Indeed, intensive agricultural production requires currently nitrogen fertilizers but it induces soil and groundwater pollution
However, this system can offer the benefit to gradually release the nitrogen in the soil thereby avoiding any form of pollution.
For this purpose, a protocol was developed to attach casein hydrolysate  on flax fibers yarns using chitosan
A cellulose coating was then added to contain and to allow a progressive release of the casein hydrolysate
Firstly, the cellulose coating stability and its compatibility with the initial casein hydrolysate attachment was demonstrated
Secondly, through an enzymatic model, it was confirmed that natural degradation will lead to casein hydrolysate release into the soil
Therefore, this study demonstrates the short flax fibers yarns functionalization interest to obtain a new eco-friendly nitrogen source, i.e
a non-polluting fertilizer for crop fields.

In this paper, the multiferroic ceramics Bi0.80La0.10Ca0.10Fe1-xMnxO3  are synthesized via conventional solid-state reaction route and their structural, Raman spectroscopy and magnetic properties are explored
Rietveld analysis carried out for all samples, revealed that the system exhibits coexistence of mainly two crystalline phases with symmetries R3c and Pbnm throughout the whole composition range
The presence of two structural phases is further supported by Raman spectroscopy analysis
The magnetic parameters, that is, magnetization, remanency, coercivity and squareness ratio are found to be enhanced by the Mn incorporation into Bi0.80La0.10Ca0.10FeO3
This is basically due to the structural modification, breaking of the incommensurate spin structure and inter-grain magnetostatic interaction in the Bi0.80La0.10Ca0.10Fe1-xMnxO3 ceramic samples
The exchange bias effect  is observed for the Mn doped sample only with 6 at
Such high value may be extremely useful for technological applications including magnetoresistive read heads and sensors.%
During the boiler operation, ash deposition can result in a decrease in boiler efficiency and an enhanced release of pollutants
To relieve these issues, the formation mechanism for initial deposition triggered by the coupling effect of sodium and calcium was investigated by the first-principles study in this paper
The results indicated that the binding of sodium and calcium deposited on Fe3O4 surface is non-covalent interaction
Furthermore, |V|/G values of different particles on the surface are less than 2 and closed to 1
So the reactions of sodium and calcium deposited on the Fe3O4 are mainly closed-shell interactions accompanied by partial covalent interaction by Atom-in-Molecule theory
Additionally, the position and form of weak interaction also be further clarified by the independent gradient model
The thermodynamic calculation results showed that Gibbs free energy change is more affected to the change of the temperature under the existence of sodium and calcium
The reaction equilibrium constants is larger than 1, indicating that sodium and calcium are easily combined with Fe3O4
Moreover, calcium is more likely to promote a positive reaction than sodium.
